# Sleep Tracking & Analysis

> [!tip] **Purpose**: Track sleep patterns, efficiency, and improvements over time to optimize recovery and productivity

---

## âš ï¸ Critical Issues Identified

### **1. Sleep Fragmentation**
- **Problem**: 2-4 sleep sessions per night
- **Impact**: Poor sleep quality despite adequate duration
- **Action**: Single sleep session target

### **2. Low Sleep Efficiency**
- **Problem**: 72% efficiency (target 85%+)
- **Impact**: 3+ hours awake in bed nightly
- **Action**: Get out of bed if awake >20 minutes

### **3. Inconsistent Schedule**
- **Problem**: Bedtime varies 1+ hour, wake time 4 AM-2 PM
- **Impact**: Disrupted circadian rhythm
- **Action**: 9:30 PM Â± 15 min bedtime, 6:30 AM Â± 30 min wake

---

## ðŸ“ˆ Improvement Plan

### **Week 1 Goals (Sep 17-24)**
- [ ] **Bedtime Consistency**: 9:30 PM Â± 15 minutes
- [ ] **Sleep Efficiency**: Target 80%+ (up from 72%)
- [ ] **Single Session**: Reduce to 1-2 sleep sessions max

### **Week 2 Goals (Sep 24-Oct 1)**
- [ ] **Wake Time Stability**: 6:30 AM Â± 30 minutes
- [ ] **Sleep Efficiency**: Target 85%+
- [ ] **Environment Optimization**: Cool, dark, quiet bedroom

### **Month 1 Goals (Sep 17-Oct 17)**
- [ ] **Beeminder Success Rate**: 85%+ (up from 71%)
- [ ] **Sleep Debt**: <2 hours cumulative
- [ ] **Fragmentation**: Single sleep session 90% of nights

---

## ðŸ“ Periodic Updates

### **Update #1 - September 17, 2025**
**Analysis Period**: August 21 - September 17, 2025
**Key Findings**:
- Meeting 7-hour Beeminder goal 71% of the time
- Sleep efficiency critically low at 72% (target 85%+)
- High sleep fragmentation (2-4 sessions per night)
- Excellent health metrics (HRV, BPM, SpO2)

**Immediate Actions**:
- Set 9:15 PM wind-down alarm
- Get out of bed if awake >20 minutes
- No electronics 1 hour before bed

**Next Update**: September 24, 2025
